description: Erlang Distribution links, inet socket, port driver, dist process + tls_connection & tls_sender

targets.expr: count(erlang_vm_dist_node_state{namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"} * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"})) OR vector(0)

panels.description: When a connection between a node and peer is established, the distribution link is considered to be `up`

targets.expr: count(erlang_vm_dist_node_state{namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"} * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"}) == 3) OR vector(0)

panels.title: Established distribution links

panels.description: When a new connection is exchanging information between the node and the peer the distribution link is considered to be `pending`

targets.expr: count(erlang_vm_dist_node_state{namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"} * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster" ,cluster="$cluster"}) == 1) OR vector(0)

panels.title: Connecting distribution links

panels.description: When a new connection is established and there is an existing connection between the node and the peer, this connection needs to wait for the initial connection to go down before it can become active. The distribution link is considered `up_pending`

targets.expr: count(erlang_vm_dist_node_state{namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"} * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"}) == 2) OR vector(0)

panels.title: Waiting distribution links

targets.expr: erlang_vm_dist_node_state{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"} * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_node, rabbitmq_cluster) max by (instance, rabbitmq_node, rabbitmq_cluster) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"})

panels.description:
Data currently buffered in the output queue of the distribution link.

Any values above the 64MB threshold hint to an overloaded distribution. This applies to the default `zdbbl` value in RabbitMQ, which is 128MB.

- [RabbitMQ Runtime Tuning - zdbbl](https://www.rabbitmq.com/runtime.html#distribution-buffer)
- [erl +zdbbl](http://erlang.org/doc/man/erl.html#+zdbbl)

targets.expr: erlang_vm_dist_node_queue_size_bytes{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"} * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_node, rabbitmq_cluster) max by (instance, rabbitmq_node, rabbitmq_cluster) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"})

panels.title: Data buffered in the distribution links queue

targets.expr: rate(erlang_vm_dist_send_bytes{namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"}[60s]) * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"})

panels.title: Data sent to peer node / s

targets.expr: rate(erlang_vm_dist_recv_bytes{namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"}[60s]) * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"})

panels.title: Data received from peer node / s

panels.description:
Number of inet packets sent to the distribution link port.

If too few messages are sent and data sits in the port driver buffer, increasing the `inet_dist_connect_options` as well as `inet_dist_listen_options` buffer values will result in more stable throughput.

targets.expr: rate(erlang_vm_dist_send_cnt{namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"}[60s]) * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"})

panels.title: Distribution messages sent to peer node / s

panels.description:
Number of inet packets received from the distribution link port.

If too many messages are received, increasing the `inet_dist_connect_options` as well as `inet_dist_listen_options` buffer values will result in more stable throughput.

targets.expr: rate(erlang_vm_dist_recv_cnt{namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"}[60s]) * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"})

panels.title: Distribution messages received from peer node / s

panels.description:
Corresponds to the average size of the argument passed to `gen_tcp:send/2` or equivalent.

Typically corresponds to TCP window size.

If TLS is used for inter-node communication, the `inet` packet size will be varied so that the system as a whole is both secure and performant.

`inet` packets larger than the TCP window will be split into TCP packets by the system kernel.

`inet` packets smaller than the TCP window _may_ be joined into TCP packets by the system kernel.

* [`inet` packet](http://erlang.org/doc/man/inet.html#packet)

targets.expr:
(rate(erlang_vm_dist_send_bytes{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"}[60s]) * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"})) / 
(rate(erlang_vm_dist_send_cnt{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"}[60s]) * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"}))

panels.title: Average inet packet size sent to peer node

panels.description:
Corresponds to the average size of the argument received from `gen_tcp:recv/2` or equivalent.

Typically corresponds to TCP window size.

If TLS is used for inter-node communication, the `inet` packet size will be varied so that the system as a whole is both secure and performant.

* [`inet` packet](http://erlang.org/doc/man/inet.html#packet)

targets.expr:
(rate(erlang_vm_dist_recv_bytes{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"}[60s]) * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"})) / 
(rate(erlang_vm_dist_recv_cnt{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"}[60s]) * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"}))

panels.title: Average inet packet size received from peer node

panels.description: The total number of bytes allocated for this port by the runtime system. The port itself can have allocated memory that is not included.

targets.expr: erlang_vm_dist_port_memory_bytes{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"} * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"})

panels.title: Memory used by the port driver

panels.description:
The total number of bytes queued by the port using the ERTS driver queue implementation

Any values above a few KBs hint to an overloaded distribution

targets.expr: erlang_vm_dist_port_queue_size_bytes{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"} * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"})

panels.title: Data in the port driver buffer

targets.expr: erlang_vm_dist_proc_status{type="$erlang_vm_dist_proc_type" ,cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"} * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_node, rabbitmq_cluster) max by (instance, rabbitmq_node, rabbitmq_cluster) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"})

panels.description:
The number of messages currently in the message queue of the process

Any values above 0 hint to an overloaded distribution

targets.expr: erlang_vm_dist_proc_message_queue_len{type="$erlang_vm_dist_proc_type", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"} * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"})

panels.title: Messages in the process queue

panels.description: The size in bytes of process memory. This includes call stack, heap, and internal structures.

targets.expr: erlang_vm_dist_proc_memory_bytes{type="$erlang_vm_dist_proc_type", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"} * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_node, rabbitmq_cluster) max by (instance, rabbitmq_node, rabbitmq_cluster) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"})

panels.title: Memory used by the process

panels.description: The number of reductions executed by the process

targets.expr: rate(erlang_vm_dist_proc_reductions{type="$erlang_vm_dist_proc_type", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"}[60s]) * on(instance) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) max by (instance, rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) (rabbitmq_identity_info{rabbitmq_cluster="$rabbitmq_cluster", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$rabbitmq_namespace"})

panels.title: Process reductions / s

title: Erlang-Distribution
